Issues.Title: Error NU1605 trying to build Winforms.sln
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
  3.0.100-preview3-010283 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  3.0.100-preview4-010480 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**

After forking dotnet/winforms master Winforms.sln does not build - there are 64 cases of errors like this:
```
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	NU1605	Detected package downgrade: Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms from 3.0.0-preview4.19118.6 to 3.0.0-preview3.19115.9. Reference the package directly from the project to select a different version. 
 System.Windows.Forms -> System.Drawing.Common 4.6.0-preview4.19118.6 -> Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms (>= 3.0.0-preview4.19118.6) 
 System.Windows.Forms -> Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms (>= 3.0.0-preview3.19115.9)	System.Windows.Forms.Ref	C:\Users\JoeErickson\source\repos\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\ref\System.Windows.Forms.Ref.csproj	1	
```

This has been an ongoing problem for a while. The workaround has been to change the ~15 C# projects to not treat NU1605 as an error.

NU1605 is explicitly set to be treated as an error in all C# projects in Winforms.sln and this makes good sense but I cannot figure out how to get the correct build of .NET Core 3. Neither the daily build nor the current Preview 3 release works. This problem has persisted for at least several weeks.

**Minimal repro:**
1) Install latest Visual Studio 2019 Preview 3 and .NET Core 3 (Preview 3 or daily build).
2) Fork and clone dotnet/winforms master.
3) Load Winforms.sln into VS 2019.
4) Try to build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error NU1605 trying to build Winforms.sln" (#477)

Issues.Title: Remove .NET Framework isms
Issues.Body:
I was just looking through the code-base and did a search on ".NET Framework".  Here are a few hits I found:

* [ResXDataNode.cs](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/15cda680cff86c1d7654f8dd675249733d002b94/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Resources/ResXDataNode.cs#L803)
* [PropertyDescriptorGridEntry.cs](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/784d45b66d34ca1f153559b7e6dbd0d20fa95c25/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/PropertyGridInternal/PropertyDescriptorGridEntry.cs#L1016)
* [AssertExtensions.cs](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/0f2036a5f45740be4718da76cf7bf247140f8864/src/Common/tests/InternalUtilitiesForTests/src/AssertExtensions.cs#L15)

I was wondering if there was going to be a structured effort to remove important .NET Framework-isms. The ones I included are all of different kinds. It would be good to see a statement (and maybe this already exists) on what kinds of .NET Framework isms should be removed/cleanedup before shipping .NET Core 3.0.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove .NET Framework isms" (#485)

Issues.Title: Clarity on style guide
Issues.Body:
What style guide should be followed? 

It looks like the original codebase followed [Brad Adam's guide](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/brada/2005/01/26/internal-coding-guidelines/) that is vastly different to the [CoreFx's one](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/Documentation/coding-guidelines/coding-style.md), that is indirectly recommended via the docs ([developer guide](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/developer-guide.md) -> [coding guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/tree/master/Documentation#coding-guidelines) -> [C# coding style](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/Documentation/coding-guidelines/coding-style.md)).

Do we use `this.variable` or `_variable`? 
Do we place usings inside or outside namespaces? 
Do we sort class members (I actually very much like that rule)?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clarity on style guide" (#484)

Issues.Title: ToolStripItem.Bounds is not correct for subitems
Issues.Body:
Mouse over a ToolStripMenuItem
I want to know if the mouse is over any ToolStripMenuItem (in main menu, or context menu, at any level).
I couldn't do it by `GetControlAtPos` method.
I can check if the context menu is visible, then check if the mouse pos is inside the rectangle of one of its items. The problem is that `ToolStripItem.Bounds` property returns the correct rectangle only for the context menu and its direct child items, but the x y pos of the next level is the same as the first level! (try any ContextMenuStrip with items and sub items).

So, Is there a current solution to get the control or menu item under the mouse cursor easily? 
If not, can you solve this in Window Forms Core?
Note that writing handlers to detect mouse hover in each menu items all over the form is not the best solution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ToolStripItem.Bounds is not correct for subitems" (#475)

Issues.Title: Required types and 'This method/object is not implemented by design.'
Issues.Body:
While trying to put our codebase on core3 rails, we faced unexpected exception that frustrated us.
 
The following types are strongly necessary for our application:
- System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem
- System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner 
 
But we catch this exception: 
System.NotImplementedException: 'This method/object is not implemented by design.' 
 
Could you confirm that these types are in your plan and will be implemented in release v3.0?
 
We are also waiting for the following types from the System.Design lib:
- System.ComponentModel.Design.UndoEngine
- System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignSurface 
- System.ComponentModel.Design.InheritanceService 
- System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionMethodItem
- System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionPropertyItem
 
Can we expect to see all the missed types in the final release?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Required types and 'This method/object is not implemented by design.'" (#469)

Issues.Title: ComboBox’s text cannot be partially selected when using mouse slides
Issues.Body:
**OS:** RS5 X64
**VS:** Dev16 16.0.0 Preview 4.0 [28612.88.d16.0]
**.NET SDK:** .NET Core 3.0.100-preview-010334 from release branch

**More info:**
The issue reproduce on when setting the "DropDownStyle" property value of the Combobox control is "Sample"/"DropDown".

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.  Open the attached .NET Core application and run it.([\\mlangfs1\public\Winforms\v-zhgl\ComboboxIssue\CoreApplication.zip](url))
2. Try to select partially text in the Combobox control using mouse slides.

**Actual**: ComboBox’s text cannot be partially selected when using mouse slides
![comboboxissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/53146214-549b8180-35de-11e9-813e-012b3a6ad75e.gif)

**Expexted**: ComboBox’s text can be partially selected when using mouse slides
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ComboBox’s text cannot be partially selected when using mouse slides" (#465)
